sn3.19:2.2: This accords with Arthaśāstra 3.5.28, “A king should take property for which there is no heir”.
sn3.19:2.7: Hemp (sāṇa) made a rough  cloth. It was not known as an intoxicant.
sn3.19:2.9: Compare the splendid chariot of the brahmin Jānussoṇi (SN 45.4:1.3).
sn3.19:3.2: The proper use of wealth includes enjoying it oneself as well as helping others.
sn3.19:8.3: Nisabha means “bull” and “chief”, both of which are covered by “boss”.
